content.description: A scrambly ascent to the far right of the South Face before the rock becomes scrubby and unclimbable. A very short slabby section at the end that can be walked around. Used this area to rappel down after setting up our top rope.
content.protection: TR setup from plentiful trees at top. Easy rappel location. Could be a potential intro/practice trad lead if cleaned some.
content.location: Farthest right on the South Face, about the last climbable section of rock before the bushes. Right of #27.

content.description: Climb a flake to a shallow dihedral. A fun, somewhat bouldery start (for a 5.8) is the crux of the route.
content.protection: Easily TRed with runners from trees. Pro to thin hands if leading.
content.location: To the right of 25 (obviously). About 25' to the right of a large stepped roof.

content.description: This small left-facing corner has a finger crack that runs to the top. The crux is right off the ground where an awkward bulge without any solid feet just to the left of the crack makes for an interesting challenge.
content.protection: Easy TR set-up with long runners from trees or nuts and small cams for leading.
content.location: This corner is about 15' to the right of an unmistakable large stepped roof (which holds a .12a line through it).

content.description: Goes left of the A-shaped overhang. Pull through and finish by moving left.    #24 (5.12b) starts up the right side of the overhang and traverses to meet #23.
content.protection: TRed from webbing/runners/gear above. Plenty of trees to sling.
content.location: Located to the left of 25 w/ the stepped overhanging section.

content.description: The obvious chimney. Start from the outside. Ends with a bit of a slabby face climb.
content.protection: Can set a TR anchor from the top, plenty of trees to sling. Shared rope w/ #23.
content.location: A few routes to the left of the overhanging roof section, nestled between the block and the main wall to the far left. Last route on the South Face.

content.description: Hot and dusty if the sun's out. Lots of foot traffic on nice days and weekends due to the Superior Hiking Trail. Worth a look if you're at Carlton Peak. This area holds about 6 or 7 routes of varying quality from 5.5 to 5.12.
